context: The word 'piki' in Finnish refers to a thick, dark, sticky substance. It is commonly used for road surfacing and can be translated as tar, pitch, asphalt or bitumen. The example sentences demonstrate its use in contexts related to roads ('Auto ajoi piikit edellä.' - The car drove ahead with spikes/tar), road conditions ('Tietä peitti paksu piki.' - The road was covered in thick tar) and road types ('Hän käveli pitkin pikitiellä.' - He walked along the asphalt road).
